page.title: 04THE COMLEY RIDING STABLES
page.content: Set into a sheltered corner of Comley,Shropshire,the riding stables are beneath the north slopes of Caer Caradoc and the southern slopes of the Lawley.The owner has been here for 14 years and at present there are 15 horses stabled,8 of them "at livery". Some are ponies for the United Pack Pony Club who train here for the Prince Philip Cup Team. There are 3 riding classes held here every Saturday morning and pupils range from children to adults of all ages. The 10+ acres surrounding the stable block and house,are a haven for wild life,such as Foxes,Badgers,Hares, Rabbits,Woodpeckers,Jays,Moorhens, Buzzards,Ravens and Doves,in addition to the more usual fauna.
